  • Log in
  • Get Bublup

    • The Cloud Reimagined

    • Keep all types of content together, visually organized the way you want.
    • Share in new and exciting ways.
    • Find fascinating, relevant content that bubbles up.

    We hope you're enjoying the app.

    Get Bublup

    Say Goodbye to Boring Blue Folders.

    You can save more than just files in your Bublup folders! Keep files AND links to all kinds of online content together, like websites, GIFs, photos, documents, videos and more. Whether you‚Äôre collecting recipes or funny memes, planning a trip with friends, or doing a work project, you can visually organize everything in one place.
    SEE IT IN ACTION

    Powerful Sharing, Made Easy.

    Invite friends to your folders any time to collaborate. Great for staying connected to the same visually organized information.

    Or transform your folders into beautiful stories and collections called ‚Äúrolls‚Äù. It literally takes a few seconds. Share them as a single link with anyone, even if they don‚Äôt have Bublup.

    Discover Something Fascinating.

    Find relevant information that "bubbles up‚Äù every day alongside the links you save in your folders and the topics you search for online.

    Our sophisticated suggestion engine works behind the scenes to crowdsource content from across the internet.

    Using Bublup is easy.

    Check out the ways our community is using Bublup today!

    Keeping Recipes Here

    I meal plan every week. Which means I‚Äôm always looking up new things to cook and saving recipes I come across online or find on instagram. Before I started using Bublup, I wasn‚Äôt meal planning – mainly because I was saving stuff in a bunch of places and didn‚Äôt want to spend the time to hunt through it all.

    Now, I just save everything into my Bublup folder so when it comes time to plan dinner for the week, I can find all my recipes in one place. The best thing is when I save it to my folder, the image saves with it, which is awesome. Who doesn‚Äôt love scrolling through photos of delicious meals when it comes time to make something for dinner?!
    - Genevieve M.

    Planning Your Next Trip

    My friends and I are planning a birthday trip to Savannah, GA. With all of us living in various cities across the country, it has been tough to keep everything organized. But by using a Bublup folder, we have been able to keep our travel plans all in the same place – our flight itineraries, links to possible activities and restaurants to eat at, even our car rental confirmation email and airbnb reservation.

    It‚Äôs really taken the pressure off any one person to manage all the details and any time someone adds a new activity to consider, I get a notification so I can stay up to date in real time
    - Leah R.

    Creating a Link in Bio

    Instagram is my favorite social media channel, and the one that I‚Äôm the most active on. But as a travel blogger with a website and many other channels, Instagram limits me by only allowing one link in my bio. To make sure my followers have quick and easy access to my website, Facebook, Twitter and other social channels, I use a Bublup roll.

    Under just one URL, I‚Äôm able to save all of the places I‚Äôd like to direct my followers. My favorite thing about a roll is that it‚Äôs customizable- I‚Äôm able to choose a theme, add my own photography, and change the text. It‚Äôs the perfect solution!
    - Lauren C.

    Apartment Hunting

    Moving to a new city is stressful enough. With all the logistics of finding a new apartment I needed something to help me streamline it all. I went to Charleston, SC to check out apartments for a weekend, and looked at more than half a dozen places. Bublup was absolutely invaluable. I saved links to the community’s websites, took pictures of the apartments, made notes about dimensions, price, and thoughts I had about each one.

    When the weekend was over, I was able to sift through them all very easily. In the end I found a great place, and couldn’t be happier with my choice. Bublup took the stress out of one of the most taxing parts of my move.
    - Sean F.

    Saving Inspiration

    I use Bublup to store ideas that inspire me. For example, I have a ‘Halloween Ideas’ folder because it is one of my favorite holidays and I legit start thinking about making my costume months in advance. I‚Äôll pop in Youtube videos to cool makeup tutorials, links to items I might want on Amazon, memes, posts about celebrity gossip, or articles of ridiculous things that happened in the news that might be funny to replicate as a costume (i.e. Lady Gaga’s famous meat dress!).

    Come October, it’s easier to decide on what to make because I’ve already got a whole folder to jog my memory about all the ideas I had throughout the year.
    - Christa R.

    Discovering New Content on Trending

    I have a wide range of interests. I like to keep up with hot topics like headline news and politics but I also like to learn something new every day. Facebook used to be my go to for finding out popular news, funny new memes, tech updates, and all sorts of other things, but now it seems as though I see the same things over and over again. So I checked out Bublup Trending.

    It has completely changed my way of staying on top of things. I can change the categories so I see just the information I want most, from international politics to celebrity gossip, and tomorrow when I need some inspo for my new house, well, home and garden, Trending has me covered with some really fun (and cheap!) DIY projects.
    - Jocelyn B.

    Group Brainstorming

    An idea has to start somewhere. With Bublup it‚Äôs easy to invite a few friends to a Group Folder for an instant brainstorm, from anywhere in the world. Whether I‚Äôm soliciting wallpaper suggestions for my dining room or coming up with new ideas with my team for an upcoming campaign, everyone I invite can add files, links, videos, or images that inspire good ideas.

    I like to add my notes to the things people share based on the conversation and break ideas down into their own little subfolders with actionable next steps. For me, there is no simpler way to get all of our ideas in one place.
    - Emily T.

    Saving from Social

    As a vlogger I needed a place to store all my videos and photos. I also like to save things I see on my twitter feed, hilarious videos my friends post on instagram, and the occasional article I find on facebook since I am constantly using these materials in my vlogs.

    Once I got my Bublup folder, I had the perfect place to put it all. I can upload video files (and send them to my friends using a single link – no more messing with file transfer apps!), tons of photos straight from my phone, and save all the stuff I find on social media so everything is in one convenient place. Now when I go to film a new vlog, I can easily find what I need because it is all in Bublup.
    - Josh P.

    Working Together

    I‚Äôm always creating, saving, and sharing all types of information at work – documents, links, videos, PDFs, presentations, and spreadsheets. I thought I was organized before, saving research and important stuff by sending it to myself in an email. Or I‚Äôd save documents to the company‚Äôs server and just bookmark the links I needed later.

    But now I use Bublup because I can put everything in one place and it is so much easier to see all my content organized together for each project. As a visual person, the fact that I can put an image on everything makes processing the information in my folders much easier. And group folders allow me to quickly create places for teams to save stuff together, so I can keep tabs on progress through notifications. Want to know the best part? I don‚Äôt have to bother IT staff!
    - Jordan L.

    Researching Products

    I started hunting for a couch last year. Not one from Craigslist but like a big-kid couch. And I never realized how many choices I had! From the big box stores, to little boutiques, to basically anything you can find online I was seriously overwhelmed. Enter Bublup. I was able to organize all my research in one folder – from links I found online to photos I took in the store, I could even put a note on each one to keep track of prices, observations on how comfy it was, and measurements (who knew sectionals came in Paul Bunyan size dimensions?!).

    I finally took the leap and bought a gorgeous light blue couch at a cute little furniture shop and breathed a sigh of relief. I couldn‚Äôt have done it without my Bublup folder – well that and a large cup of coffee, but who‚Äôs keeping track? üòâ
    - Amy W.

    TL;DR

    I consume A LOT of content and sometimes I stumble upon a goldmine of cool stuff or helpful information I can‚Äôt help but dig into. I want to consume it all, but I also need sleep, so I‚Äôm like ‚ÄúTL;DR, I get the gist.‚Äù But I‚Äôm definitely saving it for later, in case I get the time to take it in, or need to drop some knowledge at trivia. Don‚Äôt judge, we all do it.

    Most people use ‘read later apps’ to save articles, but with Bublup I can save anything for later – a couple slides my coworker sent me, funny YouTube videos from a friend, pictures from a networking event, GIFs my cousin texts me at inopportune times, and yes, all of the articles I can consume on social media.”
    - Justin J.

    Family Scrapbook

    One thing I‚Äôve been using the app for is keeping family information together. There is a lot we need at our fingertips – including reference material for school, activities, health, and shopping lists… as well as the memories of each person’s important events. Our home has appliances, equipment, and maintenance stuff to keep track of too.

    The visual layout in Bublup makes it easier to find things quickly. And more fun to browse through. Group folders related to the specific interests of kids and relatives work well. Anybody can save things, and the others see it organized when they want, without being interrupted.
    - Todd K.

    Keeping Recipes Here

    I meal plan every week. Before I started using Bublup, I wasn‚Äôt meal planning - mainly because I was saving stuff in a bunch of places.

I want to consume it all, but I also need sleep, so I‚Äôm like ‚ÄúTL;DR, I get the gist.‚Äù But I‚Äôm definitely saving it for later, in case I get the time to take it in, or need to drop some knowledge at trivia. Don‚Äôt judge, we all do it.

    Most people use ‘read later apps’ to save articles, but with Bublup I can save anything for later – a couple slides my coworker sent me, funny YouTube videos from a friend, pictures from a networking event, GIFs my cousin texts me at inopportune times, and yes, all of the articles I can consume on social media.”
    - Justin J.

    Family Scrapbook

    One thing I‚Äôve been using the app for is keeping family information together. There is a lot we need at our fingertips – including reference material for school, activities, health, and shopping lists… as well as the memories of each person’s important events. Our home has appliances, equipment, and maintenance stuff to keep track of too.

    The visual layout in Bublup makes it easier to find things quickly. And more fun to browse through. Group folders related to the specific interests of kids and relatives work well. Anybody can save things, and the others see it organized when they want, without being interrupted.
    - Todd K.

    Keeping Recipes Here

    I meal plan every week. Before I started using Bublup, I wasn‚Äôt meal planning - mainly because I was saving stuff in a bunch of places.

    Find Out How

    My friends and I are planning a birthday trip to Savannah, GA. With all of us living in various cities across the country, it has been tough to keep everything organized.

    Find Out How

    To make sure my followers have quick and easy access to my website, Facebook, Twitter and other social channels, I use a Bublup roll.

    Find Out How

    I saved links to the community's websites, took pictures of the apartments, made notes about dimensions, price, and thoughts I had about each one.

    I use Bublup to see all my content organized together for each project. As a visual person, the way everything looks is easier for me to process.

    Keeping Recipes Here

    I meal plan every week. Which means I‚Äôm always looking up new things to cook and saving recipes I come across online or find on instagram. Before I started using Bublup, I wasn‚Äôt meal planning – mainly because I was saving stuff in a bunch of places and didn‚Äôt want to spend the time to hunt through it all.

    Now, I just save everything into my Bublup folder so when it comes time to plan dinner for the week, I can find all my recipes in one place. The best thing is when I save it to my folder, the image saves with it, which is awesome. Who doesn‚Äôt love scrolling through photos of delicious meals when it comes time to make something for dinner?!
    - Genevieve M.

    Planning Your Next Trip

    My friends and I are planning a birthday trip to Savannah, GA. With all of us living in various cities across the country, it has been tough to keep everything organized. But by using a Bublup folder, we have been able to keep our travel plans all in the same place – our flight itineraries, links to possible activities and restaurants to eat at, even our car rental confirmation email and airbnb reservation.

    It‚Äôs really taken the pressure off any one person to manage all the details and any time someone adds a new activity to consider, I get a notification so I can stay up to date in real time
    - Leah R.

    Creating a Link in Bio

    Instagram is my favorite social media channel, and the one that I‚Äôm the most active on. But as a travel blogger with a website and many other channels, Instagram limits me by only allowing one link in my bio. To make sure my followers have quick and easy access to my website, Facebook, Twitter and other social channels, I use a Bublup roll.

    Under just one URL, I‚Äôm able to save all of the places I‚Äôd like to direct my followers. My favorite thing about a roll is that it‚Äôs customizable- I‚Äôm able to choose a theme, add my own photography, and change the text. It‚Äôs the perfect solution!
    - Lauren C.

    Apartment Hunting

    Moving to a new city is stressful enough. With all the logistics of finding a new apartment I needed something to help me streamline it all. I went to Charleston, SC to check out apartments for a weekend, and looked at more than half a dozen places. Bublup was absolutely invaluable. I saved links to the community’s websites, took pictures of the apartments, made notes about dimensions, price, and thoughts I had about each one.

    When the weekend was over, I was able to sift through them all very easily. In the end I found a great place, and couldn’t be happier with my choice. Bublup took the stress out of one of the most taxing parts of my move.
    - Sean F.

    Saving Inspiration

    I use Bublup to store ideas that inspire me. For example, I have a ‘Halloween Ideas’ folder because it is one of my favorite holidays and I legit start thinking about making my costume months in advance. I‚Äôll pop in Youtube videos to cool makeup tutorials, links to items I might want on Amazon, memes, posts about celebrity gossip, or articles of ridiculous things that happened in the news that might be funny to replicate as a costume (i.e. Lady Gaga’s famous meat dress!).

    Come October, it’s easier to decide on what to make because I’ve already got a whole folder to jog my memory about all the ideas I had throughout the year.
    - Christa R.

    Discovering New Content on Trending

    I have a wide range of interests. I like to keep up with hot topics like headline news and politics but I also like to learn something new every day. Facebook used to be my go to for finding out popular news, funny new memes, tech updates, and all sorts of other things, but now it seems as though I see the same things over and over again. So I checked out Bublup Trending.

    It has completely changed my way of staying on top of things. I can change the categories so I see just the information I want most, from international politics to celebrity gossip, and tomorrow when I need some inspo for my new house, well, home and garden, Trending has me covered with some really fun (and cheap!) DIY projects.
    - Jocelyn B.

    Group Brainstorming

    An idea has to start somewhere. With Bublup it‚Äôs easy to invite a few friends to a Group Folder for an instant brainstorm, from anywhere in the world. Whether I‚Äôm soliciting wallpaper suggestions for my dining room or coming up with new ideas with my team for an upcoming campaign, everyone I invite can add files, links, videos, or images that inspire good ideas.

    I like to add my notes to the things people share based on the conversation and break ideas down into their own little subfolders with actionable next steps. For me, there is no simpler way to get all of our ideas in one place.
    - Emily T.

    Saving from Social

    As a vlogger I needed a place to store all my videos and photos. I also like to save things I see on my twitter feed, hilarious videos my friends post on instagram, and the occasional article I find on facebook since I am constantly using these materials in my vlogs.

    Once I got my Bublup folder, I had the perfect place to put it all. I can upload video files (and send them to my friends using a single link – no more messing with file transfer apps!), tons of photos straight from my phone, and save all the stuff I find on social media so everything is in one convenient place. Now when I go to film a new vlog, I can easily find what I need because it is all in Bublup.
    - Josh P.

    Working Together

    I‚Äôm always creating, saving, and sharing all types of information at work – documents, links, videos, PDFs, presentations, and spreadsheets. I thought I was organized before, saving research and important stuff by sending it to myself in an email. Or I‚Äôd save documents to the company‚Äôs server and just bookmark the links I needed later.

    But now I use Bublup because I can put everything in one place and it is so much easier to see all my content organized together for each project. As a visual person, the fact that I can put an image on everything makes processing the information in my folders much easier. And group folders allow me to quickly create places for teams to save stuff together, so I can keep tabs on progress through notifications. Want to know the best part? I don‚Äôt have to bother IT staff!
    - Jordan L.

    Researching Products

    I started hunting for a couch last year. Not one from Craigslist but like a big-kid couch. And I never realized how many choices I had! From the big box stores, to little boutiques, to basically anything you can find online I was seriously overwhelmed. Enter Bublup. I was able to organize all my research in one folder – from links I found online to photos I took in the store, I could even put a note on each one to keep track of prices, observations on how comfy it was, and measurements (who knew sectionals came in Paul Bunyan size dimensions?!).

    I finally took the leap and bought a gorgeous light blue couch at a cute little furniture shop and breathed a sigh of relief. I couldn‚Äôt have done it without my Bublup folder – well that and a large cup of coffee, but who‚Äôs keeping track? üòâ
    - Amy W.

    TL;DR

    I consume A LOT of content and sometimes I stumble upon a goldmine of cool stuff or helpful information I can‚Äôt help but dig into. I want to consume it all, but I also need sleep, so I‚Äôm like ‚ÄúTL;DR, I get the gist.‚Äù But I‚Äôm definitely saving it for later, in case I get the time to take it in, or need to drop some knowledge at trivia. Don‚Äôt judge, we all do it.

    Most people use ‘read later apps’ to save articles, but with Bublup I can save anything for later – a couple slides my coworker sent me, funny YouTube videos from a friend, pictures from a networking event, GIFs my cousin texts me at inopportune times, and yes, all of the articles I can consume on social media.”
    - Justin J.

Our home has appliances, equipment, and maintenance stuff to keep track of too.

    The visual layout in Bublup makes it easier to find things quickly. And more fun to browse through. Group folders related to the specific interests of kids and relatives work well. Anybody can save things, and the others see it organized when they want, without being interrupted.
    - Todd K.

I can upload video files (and send them to my friends using a single link – no more messing with file transfer apps!), tons of photos straight from my phone, and save all the stuff I find on social media so everything is in one convenient place. Now when I go to film a new vlog, I can easily find what I need because it is all in Bublup.
    - Josh P.

    Working Together

    I‚Äôm always creating, saving, and sharing all types of information at work – documents, links, videos, PDFs, presentations, and spreadsheets. I thought I was organized before, saving research and important stuff by sending it to myself in an email. Or I‚Äôd save documents to the company‚Äôs server and just bookmark the links I needed later.

    But now I use Bublup because I can put everything in one place and it is so much easier to see all my content organized together for each project. As a visual person, the fact that I can put an image on everything makes processing the information in my folders much easier. And group folders allow me to quickly create places for teams to save stuff together, so I can keep tabs on progress through notifications. Want to know the best part? I don‚Äôt have to bother IT staff!
    - Jordan L.

    Researching Products

    I started hunting for a couch last year. Not one from Craigslist but like a big-kid couch. And I never realized how many choices I had! From the big box stores, to little boutiques, to basically anything you can find online I was seriously overwhelmed. Enter Bublup. I was able to organize all my research in one folder – from links I found online to photos I took in the store, I could even put a note on each one to keep track of prices, observations on how comfy it was, and measurements (who knew sectionals came in Paul Bunyan size dimensions?!).

    I finally took the leap and bought a gorgeous light blue couch at a cute little furniture shop and breathed a sigh of relief. I couldn‚Äôt have done it without my Bublup folder – well that and a large cup of coffee, but who‚Äôs keeping track? üòâ
    - Amy W.

    TL;DR

    I consume A LOT of content and sometimes I stumble upon a goldmine of cool stuff or helpful information I can‚Äôt help but dig into. I want to consume it all, but I also need sleep, so I‚Äôm like ‚ÄúTL;DR, I get the gist.‚Äù But I‚Äôm definitely saving it for later, in case I get the time to take it in, or need to drop some knowledge at trivia. Don‚Äôt judge, we all do it.

    Most people use ‘read later apps’ to save articles, but with Bublup I can save anything for later – a couple slides my coworker sent me, funny YouTube videos from a friend, pictures from a networking event, GIFs my cousin texts me at inopportune times, and yes, all of the articles I can consume on social media.”
    - Justin J.

    Family Scrapbook

    One thing I‚Äôve been using the app for is keeping family information together. There is a lot we need at our fingertips – including reference material for school, activities, health, and shopping lists… as well as the memories of each person’s important events. Our home has appliances, equipment, and maintenance stuff to keep track of too.

    The visual layout in Bublup makes it easier to find things quickly. And more fun to browse through. Group folders related to the specific interests of kids and relatives work well. Anybody can save things, and the others see it organized when they want, without being interrupted.
    - Todd K.

    Keeping Recipes Here

    I meal plan every week. Before I started using Bublup, I wasn‚Äôt meal planning - mainly because I was saving stuff in a bunch of places.

    Find Out How

    My friends and I are planning a birthday trip to Savannah, GA. With all of us living in various cities across the country, it has been tough to keep everything organized.

    Find Out How

    Keeping Recipes Here

    I meal plan every week. Which means I‚Äôm always looking up new things to cook and saving recipes I come across online or find on instagram. Before I started using Bublup, I wasn‚Äôt meal planning – mainly because I was saving stuff in a bunch of places and didn‚Äôt want to spend the time to hunt through it all.

    Now, I just save everything into my Bublup folder so when it comes time to plan dinner for the week, I can find all my recipes in one place. The best thing is when I save it to my folder, the image saves with it, which is awesome. Who doesn‚Äôt love scrolling through photos of delicious meals when it comes time to make something for dinner?!
    - Genevieve M.

    Planning Your Next Trip

    My friends and I are planning a birthday trip to Savannah, GA. With all of us living in various cities across the country, it has been tough to keep everything organized. But by using a Bublup folder, we have been able to keep our travel plans all in the same place – our flight itineraries, links to possible activities and restaurants to eat at, even our car rental confirmation email and airbnb reservation.

    It‚Äôs really taken the pressure off any one person to manage all the details and any time someone adds a new activity to consider, I get a notification so I can stay up to date in real time
    - Leah R.

    Creating a Link in Bio

    Instagram is my favorite social media channel, and the one that I‚Äôm the most active on. But as a travel blogger with a website and many other channels, Instagram limits me by only allowing one link in my bio. To make sure my followers have quick and easy access to my website, Facebook, Twitter and other social channels, I use a Bublup roll.

    Under just one URL, I‚Äôm able to save all of the places I‚Äôd like to direct my followers. My favorite thing about a roll is that it‚Äôs customizable- I‚Äôm able to choose a theme, add my own photography, and change the text. It‚Äôs the perfect solution!
    - Lauren C.

    Apartment Hunting

    Moving to a new city is stressful enough. With all the logistics of finding a new apartment I needed something to help me streamline it all. I went to Charleston, SC to check out apartments for a weekend, and looked at more than half a dozen places. Bublup was absolutely invaluable. I saved links to the community’s websites, took pictures of the apartments, made notes about dimensions, price, and thoughts I had about each one.

    When the weekend was over, I was able to sift through them all very easily. In the end I found a great place, and couldn’t be happier with my choice. Bublup took the stress out of one of the most taxing parts of my move.
    - Sean F.

    Saving Inspiration

    I use Bublup to store ideas that inspire me. For example, I have a ‘Halloween Ideas’ folder because it is one of my favorite holidays and I legit start thinking about making my costume months in advance. I‚Äôll pop in Youtube videos to cool makeup tutorials, links to items I might want on Amazon, memes, posts about celebrity gossip, or articles of ridiculous things that happened in the news that might be funny to replicate as a costume (i.e. Lady Gaga’s famous meat dress!).

    Come October, it’s easier to decide on what to make because I’ve already got a whole folder to jog my memory about all the ideas I had throughout the year.
    - Christa R.

    Discovering New Content on Trending

    I have a wide range of interests. I like to keep up with hot topics like headline news and politics but I also like to learn something new every day. Facebook used to be my go to for finding out popular news, funny new memes, tech updates, and all sorts of other things, but now it seems as though I see the same things over and over again. So I checked out Bublup Trending.

    It has completely changed my way of staying on top of things. I can change the categories so I see just the information I want most, from international politics to celebrity gossip, and tomorrow when I need some inspo for my new house, well, home and garden, Trending has me covered with some really fun (and cheap!) DIY projects.
    - Jocelyn B.

    Group Brainstorming

    An idea has to start somewhere. With Bublup it‚Äôs easy to invite a few friends to a Group Folder for an instant brainstorm, from anywhere in the world. Whether I‚Äôm soliciting wallpaper suggestions for my dining room or coming up with new ideas with my team for an upcoming campaign, everyone I invite can add files, links, videos, or images that inspire good ideas.

    I like to add my notes to the things people share based on the conversation and break ideas down into their own little subfolders with actionable next steps. For me, there is no simpler way to get all of our ideas in one place.
    - Emily T.

    Saving from Social

    As a vlogger I needed a place to store all my videos and photos. I also like to save things I see on my twitter feed, hilarious videos my friends post on instagram, and the occasional article I find on facebook since I am constantly using these materials in my vlogs.

    Once I got my Bublup folder, I had the perfect place to put it all. I can upload video files (and send them to my friends using a single link – no more messing with file transfer apps!), tons of photos straight from my phone, and save all the stuff I find on social media so everything is in one convenient place. Now when I go to film a new vlog, I can easily find what I need because it is all in Bublup.
    - Josh P.

For example, I have a ‘Halloween Ideas’ folder because it is one of my favorite holidays and I legit start thinking about making my costume months in advance. I‚Äôll pop in Youtube videos to cool makeup tutorials, links to items I might want on Amazon, memes, posts about celebrity gossip, or articles of ridiculous things that happened in the news that might be funny to replicate as a costume (i.e. Lady Gaga’s famous meat dress!).

    Come October, it’s easier to decide on what to make because I’ve already got a whole folder to jog my memory about all the ideas I had throughout the year.
    - Christa R.

    Discovering New Content on Trending

    I have a wide range of interests. I like to keep up with hot topics like headline news and politics but I also like to learn something new every day. Facebook used to be my go to for finding out popular news, funny new memes, tech updates, and all sorts of other things, but now it seems as though I see the same things over and over again. So I checked out Bublup Trending.

    It has completely changed my way of staying on top of things. I can change the categories so I see just the information I want most, from international politics to celebrity gossip, and tomorrow when I need some inspo for my new house, well, home and garden, Trending has me covered with some really fun (and cheap!) DIY projects.
    - Jocelyn B.

    Group Brainstorming

    An idea has to start somewhere. With Bublup it‚Äôs easy to invite a few friends to a Group Folder for an instant brainstorm, from anywhere in the world. Whether I‚Äôm soliciting wallpaper suggestions for my dining room or coming up with new ideas with my team for an upcoming campaign, everyone I invite can add files, links, videos, or images that inspire good ideas.

    I like to add my notes to the things people share based on the conversation and break ideas down into their own little subfolders with actionable next steps. For me, there is no simpler way to get all of our ideas in one place.
    - Emily T.

    Saving from Social

    As a vlogger I needed a place to store all my videos and photos. I also like to save things I see on my twitter feed, hilarious videos my friends post on instagram, and the occasional article I find on facebook since I am constantly using these materials in my vlogs.

    Once I got my Bublup folder, I had the perfect place to put it all. I can upload video files (and send them to my friends using a single link – no more messing with file transfer apps!), tons of photos straight from my phone, and save all the stuff I find on social media so everything is in one convenient place. Now when I go to film a new vlog, I can easily find what I need because it is all in Bublup.
    - Josh P.

    Working Together

    I‚Äôm always creating, saving, and sharing all types of information at work – documents, links, videos, PDFs, presentations, and spreadsheets. I thought I was organized before, saving research and important stuff by sending it to myself in an email. Or I‚Äôd save documents to the company‚Äôs server and just bookmark the links I needed later.

    But now I use Bublup because I can put everything in one place and it is so much easier to see all my content organized together for each project. As a visual person, the fact that I can put an image on everything makes processing the information in my folders much easier. And group folders allow me to quickly create places for teams to save stuff together, so I can keep tabs on progress through notifications. Want to know the best part? I don‚Äôt have to bother IT staff!
    - Jordan L.

    Researching Products

    I started hunting for a couch last year. Not one from Craigslist but like a big-kid couch. And I never realized how many choices I had! From the big box stores, to little boutiques, to basically anything you can find online I was seriously overwhelmed. Enter Bublup. I was able to organize all my research in one folder – from links I found online to photos I took in the store, I could even put a note on each one to keep track of prices, observations on how comfy it was, and measurements (who knew sectionals came in Paul Bunyan size dimensions?!).

    I finally took the leap and bought a gorgeous light blue couch at a cute little furniture shop and breathed a sigh of relief. I couldn‚Äôt have done it without my Bublup folder – well that and a large cup of coffee, but who‚Äôs keeping track? üòâ
    - Amy W.

    TL;DR

    I consume A LOT of content and sometimes I stumble upon a goldmine of cool stuff or helpful information I can‚Äôt help but dig into. I want to consume it all, but I also need sleep, so I‚Äôm like ‚ÄúTL;DR, I get the gist.‚Äù But I‚Äôm definitely saving it for later, in case I get the time to take it in, or need to drop some knowledge at trivia. Don‚Äôt judge, we all do it.

    Most people use ‘read later apps’ to save articles, but with Bublup I can save anything for later – a couple slides my coworker sent me, funny YouTube videos from a friend, pictures from a networking event, GIFs my cousin texts me at inopportune times, and yes, all of the articles I can consume on social media.”
    - Justin J.

    Family Scrapbook

    One thing I‚Äôve been using the app for is keeping family information together. There is a lot we need at our fingertips – including reference material for school, activities, health, and shopping lists… as well as the memories of each person’s important events. Our home has appliances, equipment, and maintenance stuff to keep track of too.

    The visual layout in Bublup makes it easier to find things quickly. And more fun to browse through. Group folders related to the specific interests of kids and relatives work well. Anybody can save things, and the others see it organized when they want, without being interrupted.
    - Todd K.

    Keeping Recipes Here

    I meal plan every week. Before I started using Bublup, I wasn‚Äôt meal planning - mainly because I was saving stuff in a bunch of places.

    Find Out How

    Planning Your Next Trip

    My friends and I are planning a birthday trip to Savannah, GA. With all of us living in various cities across the country, it has been tough to keep everything organized.

    Find Out How

    Keeping Recipes Here

    I meal plan every week. Which means I‚Äôm always looking up new things to cook and saving recipes I come across online or find on instagram. Before I started using Bublup, I wasn‚Äôt meal planning – mainly because I was saving stuff in a bunch of places and didn‚Äôt want to spend the time to hunt through it all.

    Now, I just save everything into my Bublup folder so when it comes time to plan dinner for the week, I can find all my recipes in one place. The best thing is when I save it to my folder, the image saves with it, which is awesome. Who doesn‚Äôt love scrolling through photos of delicious meals when it comes time to make something for dinner?!
    - Genevieve M.

    Planning Your Next Trip

    My friends and I are planning a birthday trip to Savannah, GA. With all of us living in various cities across the country, it has been tough to keep everything organized. But by using a Bublup folder, we have been able to keep our travel plans all in the same place – our flight itineraries, links to possible activities and restaurants to eat at, even our car rental confirmation email and airbnb reservation.

    It‚Äôs really taken the pressure off any one person to manage all the details and any time someone adds a new activity to consider, I get a notification so I can stay up to date in real time
    - Leah R.

    Creating a Link in Bio

    Instagram is my favorite social media channel, and the one that I‚Äôm the most active on. But as a travel blogger with a website and many other channels, Instagram limits me by only allowing one link in my bio. To make sure my followers have quick and easy access to my website, Facebook, Twitter and other social channels, I use a Bublup roll.

    Under just one URL, I‚Äôm able to save all of the places I‚Äôd like to direct my followers. My favorite thing about a roll is that it‚Äôs customizable- I‚Äôm able to choose a theme, add my own photography, and change the text. It‚Äôs the perfect solution!
    - Lauren C.

    Apartment Hunting

    Moving to a new city is stressful enough. With all the logistics of finding a new apartment I needed something to help me streamline it all. I went to Charleston, SC to check out apartments for a weekend, and looked at more than half a dozen places. Bublup was absolutely invaluable. I saved links to the community’s websites, took pictures of the apartments, made notes about dimensions, price, and thoughts I had about each one.

    When the weekend was over, I was able to sift through them all very easily. In the end I found a great place, and couldn’t be happier with my choice. Bublup took the stress out of one of the most taxing parts of my move.
    - Sean F.

    Saving Inspiration

    I use Bublup to store ideas that inspire me. For example, I have a ‘Halloween Ideas’ folder because it is one of my favorite holidays and I legit start thinking about making my costume months in advance. I‚Äôll pop in Youtube videos to cool makeup tutorials, links to items I might want on Amazon, memes, posts about celebrity gossip, or articles of ridiculous things that happened in the news that might be funny to replicate as a costume (i.e. Lady Gaga’s famous meat dress!).

    Come October, it’s easier to decide on what to make because I’ve already got a whole folder to jog my memory about all the ideas I had throughout the year.
    - Christa R.

    Planning Your Next Trip

    My friends and I are planning a birthday trip to Savannah, GA. With all of us living in various cities across the country, it has been tough to keep everything organized. But by using a Bublup folder, we have been able to keep our travel plans all in the same place – our flight itineraries, links to possible activities and restaurants to eat at, even our car rental confirmation email and airbnb reservation.

    It‚Äôs really taken the pressure off any one person to manage all the details and any time someone adds a new activity to consider, I get a notification so I can stay up to date in real time
    - Leah R.

    Creating a Link in Bio

    Instagram is my favorite social media channel, and the one that I‚Äôm the most active on. But as a travel blogger with a website and many other channels, Instagram limits me by only allowing one link in my bio. To make sure my followers have quick and easy access to my website, Facebook, Twitter and other social channels, I use a Bublup roll.

    Under just one URL, I‚Äôm able to save all of the places I‚Äôd like to direct my followers. My favorite thing about a roll is that it‚Äôs customizable- I‚Äôm able to choose a theme, add my own photography, and change the text. It‚Äôs the perfect solution!
    - Lauren C.

    Apartment Hunting

    Moving to a new city is stressful enough. With all the logistics of finding a new apartment I needed something to help me streamline it all. I went to Charleston, SC to check out apartments for a weekend, and looked at more than half a dozen places. Bublup was absolutely invaluable. I saved links to the community’s websites, took pictures of the apartments, made notes about dimensions, price, and thoughts I had about each one.

    When the weekend was over, I was able to sift through them all very easily. In the end I found a great place, and couldn’t be happier with my choice. Bublup took the stress out of one of the most taxing parts of my move.
    - Sean F.

    Saving Inspiration

    I use Bublup to store ideas that inspire me. For example, I have a ‘Halloween Ideas’ folder because it is one of my favorite holidays and I legit start thinking about making my costume months in advance. I‚Äôll pop in Youtube videos to cool makeup tutorials, links to items I might want on Amazon, memes, posts about celebrity gossip, or articles of ridiculous things that happened in the news that might be funny to replicate as a costume (i.e. Lady Gaga’s famous meat dress!).

    Come October, it’s easier to decide on what to make because I’ve already got a whole folder to jog my memory about all the ideas I had throughout the year.
    - Christa R.

    Discovering New Content on Trending

    I have a wide range of interests. I like to keep up with hot topics like headline news and politics but I also like to learn something new every day. Facebook used to be my go to for finding out popular news, funny new memes, tech updates, and all sorts of other things, but now it seems as though I see the same things over and over again. So I checked out Bublup Trending.

    It has completely changed my way of staying on top of things. I can change the categories so I see just the information I want most, from international politics to celebrity gossip, and tomorrow when I need some inspo for my new house, well, home and garden, Trending has me covered with some really fun (and cheap!) DIY projects.
    - Jocelyn B.

    Group Brainstorming

    An idea has to start somewhere. With Bublup it‚Äôs easy to invite a few friends to a Group Folder for an instant brainstorm, from anywhere in the world. Whether I‚Äôm soliciting wallpaper suggestions for my dining room or coming up with new ideas with my team for an upcoming campaign, everyone I invite can add files, links, videos, or images that inspire good ideas.

    I like to add my notes to the things people share based on the conversation and break ideas down into their own little subfolders with actionable next steps. For me, there is no simpler way to get all of our ideas in one place.
    - Emily T.

    Saving from Social

    As a vlogger I needed a place to store all my videos and photos. I also like to save things I see on my twitter feed, hilarious videos my friends post on instagram, and the occasional article I find on facebook since I am constantly using these materials in my vlogs.

    Once I got my Bublup folder, I had the perfect place to put it all. I can upload video files (and send them to my friends using a single link – no more messing with file transfer apps!), tons of photos straight from my phone, and save all the stuff I find on social media so everything is in one convenient place. Now when I go to film a new vlog, I can easily find what I need because it is all in Bublup.
    - Josh P.

    Working Together

    I‚Äôm always creating, saving, and sharing all types of information at work – documents, links, videos, PDFs, presentations, and spreadsheets. I thought I was organized before, saving research and important stuff by sending it to myself in an email. Or I‚Äôd save documents to the company‚Äôs server and just bookmark the links I needed later.

    But now I use Bublup because I can put everything in one place and it is so much easier to see all my content organized together for each project. As a visual person, the fact that I can put an image on everything makes processing the information in my folders much easier. And group folders allow me to quickly create places for teams to save stuff together, so I can keep tabs on progress through notifications. Want to know the best part? I don‚Äôt have to bother IT staff!
    - Jordan L.

    Researching Products

    I started hunting for a couch last year. Not one from Craigslist but like a big-kid couch. And I never realized how many choices I had! From the big box stores, to little boutiques, to basically anything you can find online I was seriously overwhelmed. Enter Bublup. I was able to organize all my research in one folder – from links I found online to photos I took in the store, I could even put a note on each one to keep track of prices, observations on how comfy it was, and measurements (who knew sectionals came in Paul Bunyan size dimensions?!).

    I finally took the leap and bought a gorgeous light blue couch at a cute little furniture shop and breathed a sigh of relief. I couldn‚Äôt have done it without my Bublup folder – well that and a large cup of coffee, but who‚Äôs keeping track? üòâ
    - Amy W.

    TL;DR

    I consume A LOT of content and sometimes I stumble upon a goldmine of cool stuff or helpful information I can‚Äôt help but dig into. I want to consume it all, but I also need sleep, so I‚Äôm like ‚ÄúTL;DR, I get the gist.‚Äù But I‚Äôm definitely saving it for later, in case I get the time to take it in, or need to drop some knowledge at trivia. Don‚Äôt judge, we all do it.

    Most people use ‘read later apps’ to save articles, but with Bublup I can save anything for later – a couple slides my coworker sent me, funny YouTube videos from a friend, pictures from a networking event, GIFs my cousin texts me at inopportune times, and yes, all of the articles I can consume on social media.”
    - Justin J.

    Family Scrapbook

    One thing I‚Äôve been using the app for is keeping family information together. There is a lot we need at our fingertips – including reference material for school, activities, health, and shopping lists… as well as the memories of each person’s important events. Our home has appliances, equipment, and maintenance stuff to keep track of too.

    The visual layout in Bublup makes it easier to find things quickly. And more fun to browse through. Group folders related to the specific interests of kids and relatives work well. Anybody can save things, and the others see it organized when they want, without being interrupted.
    - Todd K.

    Keeping Recipes Here

    I meal plan every week. Before I started using Bublup, I wasn‚Äôt meal planning - mainly because I was saving stuff in a bunch of places.

    Find Out How

    Keeping Recipes Here

    I meal plan every week. Which means I‚Äôm always looking up new things to cook and saving recipes I come across online or find on instagram. Before I started using Bublup, I wasn‚Äôt meal planning – mainly because I was saving stuff in a bunch of places and didn‚Äôt want to spend the time to hunt through it all.

    Now, I just save everything into my Bublup folder so when it comes time to plan dinner for the week, I can find all my recipes in one place. The best thing is when I save it to my folder, the image saves with it, which is awesome. Who doesn‚Äôt love scrolling through photos of delicious meals when it comes time to make something for dinner?!
    - Genevieve M.

    Planning Your Next Trip

    My friends and I are planning a birthday trip to Savannah, GA. With all of us living in various cities across the country, it has been tough to keep everything organized.     Working Together

    I use Bublup to see all my content organized together for each project. As a visual person, the way everything looks is easier for me to process.

    Find Out How

    Researching Products

    I started hunting for a couch last year. Enter Bublup. I was able to organize all my research in one folder - from links I found online to photos I took in the store.

    Find Out How

    TL;DR

    I consume A LOT of content, I want to consume it all, but I also need sleep, so I‚Äôm like ‚ÄúTL;DR, I get the gist.‚Äù But I‚Äôm definitely saving it for later.

    Find Out How

    Family Scrapbook

    The visual layout in Bublup makes it easier to find things quickly. And more fun to browse through. Group folders related to the specific interests of kids and relatives work well.

    Find Out How

    Ready for a more fun way to organize information?

    Get Bublup

    Keeping Recipes Here

    I meal plan every week. Which means I‚Äôm always looking up new things to cook and saving recipes I come across online or find on instagram. Before I started using Bublup, I wasn‚Äôt meal planning – mainly because I was saving stuff in a bunch of places and didn‚Äôt want to spend the time to hunt through it all.

    Now, I just save everything into my Bublup folder so when it comes time to plan dinner for the week, I can find all my recipes in one place. The best thing is when I save it to my folder, the image saves with it, which is awesome. Who doesn‚Äôt love scrolling through photos of delicious meals when it comes time to make something for dinner?!
    - Genevieve M.

    Planning Your Next Trip

    My friends and I are planning a birthday trip to Savannah, GA. With all of us living in various cities across the country, it has been tough to keep everything organized. But by using a Bublup folder, we have been able to keep our travel plans all in the same place – our flight itineraries, links to possible activities and restaurants to eat at, even our car rental confirmation email and airbnb reservation.

    It‚Äôs really taken the pressure off any one person to manage all the details and any time someone adds a new activity to consider, I get a notification so I can stay up to date in real time
    - Leah R.

    Creating a Link in Bio

    Instagram is my favorite social media channel, and the one that I‚Äôm the most active on. But as a travel blogger with a website and many other channels, Instagram limits me by only allowing one link in my bio. To make sure my followers have quick and easy access to my website, Facebook, Twitter and other social channels, I use a Bublup roll.

    Under just one URL, I‚Äôm able to save all of the places I‚Äôd like to direct my followers. My favorite thing about a roll is that it‚Äôs customizable- I‚Äôm able to choose a theme, add my own photography, and change the text. It‚Äôs the perfect solution!
    - Lauren C.

    Apartment Hunting

    Moving to a new city is stressful enough. With all the logistics of finding a new apartment I needed something to help me streamline it all. I went to Charleston, SC to check out apartments for a weekend, and looked at more than half a dozen places. Bublup was absolutely invaluable. I saved links to the community’s websites, took pictures of the apartments, made notes about dimensions, price, and thoughts I had about each one.

    When the weekend was over, I was able to sift through them all very easily. In the end I found a great place, and couldn’t be happier with my choice. Bublup took the stress out of one of the most taxing parts of my move.
    - Sean F.

    Saving Inspiration

    I use Bublup to store ideas that inspire me. For example, I have a ‘Halloween Ideas’ folder because it is one of my favorite holidays and I legit start thinking about making my costume months in advance. I‚Äôll pop in Youtube videos to cool makeup tutorials, links to items I might want on Amazon, memes, posts about celebrity gossip, or articles of ridiculous things that happened in the news that might be funny to replicate as a costume (i.e. Lady Gaga’s famous meat dress!).

    Come October, it’s easier to decide on what to make because I’ve already got a whole folder to jog my memory about all the ideas I had throughout the year.
    - Christa R.

    Discovering New Content on Trending

    I have a wide range of interests. I like to keep up with hot topics like headline news and politics but I also like to learn something new every day. Facebook used to be my go to for finding out popular news, funny new memes, tech updates, and all sorts of other things, but now it seems as though I see the same things over and over again. So I checked out Bublup Trending.

    It has completely changed my way of staying on top of things. I can change the categories so I see just the information I want most, from international politics to celebrity gossip, and tomorrow when I need some inspo for my new house, well, home and garden, Trending has me covered with some really fun (and cheap!) DIY projects.
    - Jocelyn B.

    Group Brainstorming

    An idea has to start somewhere. With Bublup it‚Äôs easy to invite a few friends to a Group Folder for an instant brainstorm, from anywhere in the world. Whether I‚Äôm soliciting wallpaper suggestions for my dining room or coming up with new ideas with my team for an upcoming campaign, everyone I invite can add files, links, videos, or images that inspire good ideas.

    I like to add my notes to the things people share based on the conversation and break ideas down into their own little subfolders with actionable next steps. For me, there is no simpler way to get all of our ideas in one place.
    - Emily T.

    Saving from Social

    As a vlogger I needed a place to store all my videos and photos. I also like to save things I see on my twitter feed, hilarious videos my friends post on instagram, and the occasional article I find on facebook since I am constantly using these materials in my vlogs.

    Once I got my Bublup folder, I had the perfect place to put it all. I can upload video files (and send them to my friends using a single link – no more messing with file transfer apps!), tons of photos straight from my phone, and save all the stuff I find on social media so everything is in one convenient place. Now when I go to film a new vlog, I can easily find what I need because it is all in Bublup.
    - Josh P.

    Working Together

    I‚Äôm always creating, saving, and sharing all types of information at work – documents, links, videos, PDFs, presentations, and spreadsheets. I thought I was organized before, saving research and important stuff by sending it to myself in an email. Or I‚Äôd save documents to the company‚Äôs server and just bookmark the links I needed later.

    But now I use Bublup because I can put everything in one place and it is so much easier to see all my content organized together for each project. As a visual person, the fact that I can put an image on everything makes processing the information in my folders much easier. And group folders allow me to quickly create places for teams to save stuff together, so I can keep tabs on progress through notifications. Want to know the best part? I don‚Äôt have to bother IT staff!
    - Jordan L.

    Researching Products

    I started hunting for a couch last year. Not one from Craigslist but like a big-kid couch. And I never realized how many choices I had! From the big box stores, to little boutiques, to basically anything you can find online I was seriously overwhelmed. Enter Bublup. I was able to organize all my research in one folder – from links I found online to photos I took in the store, I could even put a note on each one to keep track of prices, observations on how comfy it was, and measurements (who knew sectionals came in Paul Bunyan size dimensions?!).

    I finally took the leap and bought a gorgeous light blue couch at a cute little furniture shop and breathed a sigh of relief. I couldn‚Äôt have done it without my Bublup folder – well that and a large cup of coffee, but who‚Äôs keeping track? üòâ
    - Amy W.

    TL;DR

    I consume A LOT of content and sometimes I stumble upon a goldmine of cool stuff or helpful information I can‚Äôt help but dig into. I want to consume it all, but I also need sleep, so I‚Äôm like ‚ÄúTL;DR, I get the gist.‚Äù But I‚Äôm definitely saving it for later, in case I get the time to take it in, or need to drop some knowledge at trivia. Don‚Äôt judge, we all do it.

    Most people use ‘read later apps’ to save articles, but with Bublup I can save anything for later – a couple slides my coworker sent me, funny YouTube videos from a friend, pictures from a networking event, GIFs my cousin texts me at inopportune times, and yes, all of the articles I can consume on social media.”
    - Justin J.

    Family Scrapbook

    One thing I‚Äôve been using the app for is keeping family information together. There is a lot we need at our fingertips – including reference material for school, activities, health, and shopping lists… as well as the memories of each person’s important events. Our home has appliances, equipment, and maintenance stuff to keep track of too.

    The visual layout in Bublup makes it easier to find things quickly. And more fun to browse through. Group folders related to the specific interests of kids and relatives work well. Anybody can save things, and the others see it organized when they want, without being interrupted.
    - Todd K.

    Family Scrapbook

    One thing I‚Äôve been using the app for is keeping family information together. There is a lot we need at our fingertips – including reference material for school, activities, health, and shopping lists… as well as the memories of each person’s important events. Our home has appliances, equipment, and maintenance stuff to keep track of too.

    The visual layout in Bublup makes it easier to find things quickly. And more fun to browse through. Group folders related to the specific interests of kids and relatives work well. Anybody can save things, and the others see it organized when they want, without being interrupted.
    - Todd K.

    Keeping Recipes Here

    I meal plan every week. Before I started using Bublup, I wasn‚Äôt meal planning - mainly because I was saving stuff in a bunch of places.

    Find Out How

    Planning Your Next Trip

    My friends and I are planning a birthday trip to Savannah, GA. With all of us living in various cities across the country, it has been tough to keep everything organized.

    Find Out How

    Creating a Link in Bio

    To make sure my followers have quick and easy access to my website, Facebook, Twitter and other social channels, I use a Bublup roll.

    Find Out How

    Apartment Hunting

    I saved links to the community's websites, took pictures of the apartments, made notes about dimensions, price, and thoughts I had about each one.

    Find Out How

    Saving Inspiration

    I use Bublup to store ideas that inspire me. For example, I have a "Halloween Ideas" folder because it is one of my favorite holidays.

    Find Out How

    Discovering New Content on Trending

    I have a wide range of interests. I like to keep up with hot topics like headline news and politics but I also like to learn something new every day.

    Find Out How

    An idea has to start somewhere. With Bublup it‚Äôs easy to invite a few friends to a Group Folder for an instant brainstorm, from anywhere in the world.

    Find Out How

    Saving from Social

    As a vlogger I needed a place to store all my videos and photos. Once I got my Bublup folder, I had the perfect place to put it all.

    Find Out How

    Working Together

    I use Bublup to see all my content organized together for each project. As a visual person, the way everything looks is easier for me to process.

    Find Out How

    Researching Products

    I started hunting for a couch last year. Enter Bublup. I was able to organize all my research in one folder - from links I found online to photos I took in the store.

    Find Out How

    TL;DR

    I consume A LOT of content, I want to consume it all, but I also need sleep, so I‚Äôm like ‚ÄúTL;DR, I get the gist.‚Äù But I‚Äôm definitely saving it for later.

    Find Out How

    Keeping Recipes Here

    I meal plan every week. Which means I‚Äôm always looking up new things to cook and saving recipes I come across online or find on instagram. Before I started using Bublup, I wasn‚Äôt meal planning – mainly because I was saving stuff in a bunch of places and didn‚Äôt want to spend the time to hunt through it all.

    Now, I just save everything into my Bublup folder so when it comes time to plan dinner for the week, I can find all my recipes in one place. The best thing is when I save it to my folder, the image saves with it, which is awesome. Who doesn‚Äôt love scrolling through photos of delicious meals when it comes time to make something for dinner?!
    - Genevieve M.

    Planning Your Next Trip

    My friends and I are planning a birthday trip to Savannah, GA. With all of us living in various cities across the country, it has been tough to keep everything organized. But by using a Bublup folder, we have been able to keep our travel plans all in the same place – our flight itineraries, links to possible activities and restaurants to eat at, even our car rental confirmation email and airbnb reservation.

    It‚Äôs really taken the pressure off any one person to manage all the details and any time someone adds a new activity to consider, I get a notification so I can stay up to date in real time
    - Leah R.

    Creating a Link in Bio

    Instagram is my favorite social media channel, and the one that I‚Äôm the most active on. But as a travel blogger with a website and many other channels, Instagram limits me by only allowing one link in my bio. To make sure my followers have quick and easy access to my website, Facebook, Twitter and other social channels, I use a Bublup roll.

    Under just one URL, I‚Äôm able to save all of the places I‚Äôd like to direct my followers. My favorite thing about a roll is that it‚Äôs customizable- I‚Äôm able to choose a theme, add my own photography, and change the text. It‚Äôs the perfect solution!
    - Lauren C.

    Apartment Hunting

    Moving to a new city is stressful enough. With all the logistics of finding a new apartment I needed something to help me streamline it all. I went to Charleston, SC to check out apartments for a weekend, and looked at more than half a dozen places. Bublup was absolutely invaluable. I saved links to the community’s websites, took pictures of the apartments, made notes about dimensions, price, and thoughts I had about each one.

    When the weekend was over, I was able to sift through them all very easily. In the end I found a great place, and couldn’t be happier with my choice. Bublup took the stress out of one of the most taxing parts of my move.
    - Sean F.

    Saving Inspiration

    I use Bublup to store ideas that inspire me. For example, I have a ‘Halloween Ideas’ folder because it is one of my favorite holidays and I legit start thinking about making my costume months in advance. I‚Äôll pop in Youtube videos to cool makeup tutorials, links to items I might want on Amazon, memes, posts about celebrity gossip, or articles of ridiculous things that happened in the news that might be funny to replicate as a costume (i.e. Lady Gaga’s famous meat dress!).

    Come October, it’s easier to decide on what to make because I’ve already got a whole folder to jog my memory about all the ideas I had throughout the year.
    - Christa R.

    Discovering New Content on Trending

    I have a wide range of interests. I like to keep up with hot topics like headline news and politics but I also like to learn something new every day. Facebook used to be my go to for finding out popular news, funny new memes, tech updates, and all sorts of other things, but now it seems as though I see the same things over and over again. So I checked out Bublup Trending.

    It has completely changed my way of staying on top of things. I can change the categories so I see just the information I want most, from international politics to celebrity gossip, and tomorrow when I need some inspo for my new house, well, home and garden, Trending has me covered with some really fun (and cheap!) DIY projects.
    - Jocelyn B.

    Group Brainstorming

    An idea has to start somewhere. With Bublup it‚Äôs easy to invite a few friends to a Group Folder for an instant brainstorm, from anywhere in the world. Whether I‚Äôm soliciting wallpaper suggestions for my dining room or coming up with new ideas with my team for an upcoming campaign, everyone I invite can add files, links, videos, or images that inspire good ideas.

    I like to add my notes to the things people share based on the conversation and break ideas down into their own little subfolders with actionable next steps. For me, there is no simpler way to get all of our ideas in one place.
    - Emily T.

    Saving from Social

    As a vlogger I needed a place to store all my videos and photos. I also like to save things I see on my twitter feed, hilarious videos my friends post on instagram, and the occasional article I find on facebook since I am constantly using these materials in my vlogs.

    Once I got my Bublup folder, I had the perfect place to put it all. I can upload video files (and send them to my friends using a single link – no more messing with file transfer apps!), tons of photos straight from my phone, and save all the stuff I find on social media so everything is in one convenient place. Now when I go to film a new vlog, I can easily find what I need because it is all in Bublup.
    - Josh P.

    Working Together

    I‚Äôm always creating, saving, and sharing all types of information at work – documents, links, videos, PDFs, presentations, and spreadsheets. I thought I was organized before, saving research and important stuff by sending it to myself in an email. Or I‚Äôd save documents to the company‚Äôs server and just bookmark the links I needed later.

    But now I use Bublup because I can put everything in one place and it is so much easier to see all my content organized together for each project. As a visual person, the fact that I can put an image on everything makes processing the information in my folders much easier. And group folders allow me to quickly create places for teams to save stuff together, so I can keep tabs on progress through notifications. Want to know the best part? I don‚Äôt have to bother IT staff!
    - Jordan L.

    Researching Products

    I started hunting for a couch last year. Not one from Craigslist but like a big-kid couch. And I never realized how many choices I had! From the big box stores, to little boutiques, to basically anything you can find online I was seriously overwhelmed. Enter Bublup. I was able to organize all my research in one folder – from links I found online to photos I took in the store, I could even put a note on each one to keep track of prices, observations on how comfy it was, and measurements (who knew sectionals came in Paul Bunyan size dimensions?!).

    I finally took the leap and bought a gorgeous light blue couch at a cute little furniture shop and breathed a sigh of relief. I couldn‚Äôt have done it without my Bublup folder – well that and a large cup of coffee, but who‚Äôs keeping track? üòâ
    - Amy W.

    TL;DR

    I consume A LOT of content and sometimes I stumble upon a goldmine of cool stuff or helpful information I can‚Äôt help but dig into. I want to consume it all, but I also need sleep, so I‚Äôm like ‚ÄúTL;DR, I get the gist.‚Äù But I‚Äôm definitely saving it for later, in case I get the time to take it in, or need to drop some knowledge at trivia. Don‚Äôt judge, we all do it.

    Most people use ‘read later apps’ to save articles, but with Bublup I can save anything for later – a couple slides my coworker sent me, funny YouTube videos from a friend, pictures from a networking event, GIFs my cousin texts me at inopportune times, and yes, all of the articles I can consume on social media.”
    - Justin J.

    Family Scrapbook

    One thing I‚Äôve been using the app for is keeping family information together. There is a lot we need at our fingertips – including reference material for school, activities, health, and shopping lists… as well as the memories of each person’s important events. Our home has appliances, equipment, and maintenance stuff to keep track of too.

    The visual layout in Bublup makes it easier to find things quickly. And more fun to browse through. Group folders related to the specific interests of kids and relatives work well. Anybody can save things, and the others see it organized when they want, without being interrupted.
    - Todd K.

    But now I use Bublup because I can put everything in one place and it is so much easier to see all my content organized together for each project. As a visual person, the fact that I can put an image on everything makes processing the information in my folders much easier. And group folders allow me to quickly create places for teams to save stuff together, so I can keep tabs on progress through notifications. Want to know the best part? I don‚Äôt have to bother IT staff!
    - Jordan L.

    Researching Products

    I started hunting for a couch last year. Not one from Craigslist but like a big-kid couch. And I never realized how many choices I had! From the big box stores, to little boutiques, to basically anything you can find online I was seriously overwhelmed. Enter Bublup. I was able to organize all my research in one folder – from links I found online to photos I took in the store, I could even put a note on each one to keep track of prices, observations on how comfy it was, and measurements (who knew sectionals came in Paul Bunyan size dimensions?!).

    I finally took the leap and bought a gorgeous light blue couch at a cute little furniture shop and breathed a sigh of relief. I couldn‚Äôt have done it without my Bublup folder – well that and a large cup of coffee, but who‚Äôs keeping track? üòâ
    - Amy W.

    TL;DR

    I consume A LOT of content and sometimes I stumble upon a goldmine of cool stuff or helpful information I can‚Äôt help but dig into. I want to consume it all, but I also need sleep, so I‚Äôm like ‚ÄúTL;DR, I get the gist.‚Äù But I‚Äôm definitely saving it for later, in case I get the time to take it in, or need to drop some knowledge at trivia. Don‚Äôt judge, we all do it.

    Most people use ‘read later apps’ to save articles, but with Bublup I can save anything for later – a couple slides my coworker sent me, funny YouTube videos from a friend, pictures from a networking event, GIFs my cousin texts me at inopportune times, and yes, all of the articles I can consume on social media.”
    - Justin J.

    Family Scrapbook

    One thing I‚Äôve been using the app for is keeping family information together. There is a lot we need at our fingertips – including reference material for school, activities, health, and shopping lists… as well as the memories of each person’s important events. Our home has appliances, equipment, and maintenance stuff to keep track of too.

    The visual layout in Bublup makes it easier to find things quickly. And more fun to browse through. Group folders related to the specific interests of kids and relatives work well. Anybody can save things, and the others see it organized when they want, without being interrupted.
    - Todd K.

    Keeping Recipes Here

    I meal plan every week. Before I started using Bublup, I wasn‚Äôt meal planning - mainly because I was saving stuff in a bunch of places.

    Find Out How

    Keeping Recipes Here

    I meal plan every week. Which means I‚Äôm always looking up new things to cook and saving recipes I come across online or find on instagram. Before I started using Bublup, I wasn‚Äôt meal planning – mainly because I was saving stuff in a bunch of places and didn‚Äôt want to spend the time to hunt through it all.

    Now, I just save everything into my Bublup folder so when it comes time to plan dinner for the week, I can find all my recipes in one place. The best thing is when I save it to my folder, the image saves with it, which is awesome. Who doesn‚Äôt love scrolling through photos of delicious meals when it comes time to make something for dinner?!
    - Genevieve M.

    Planning Your Next Trip

    My friends and I are planning a birthday trip to Savannah, GA. With all of us living in various cities across the country, it has been tough to keep everything organized. But by using a Bublup folder, we have been able to keep our travel plans all in the same place – our flight itineraries, links to possible activities and restaurants to eat at, even our car rental confirmation email and airbnb reservation.

    It‚Äôs really taken the pressure off any one person to manage all the details and any time someone adds a new activity to consider, I get a notification so I can stay up to date in real time
    - Leah R.

    Creating a Link in Bio

    Instagram is my favorite social media channel, and the one that I‚Äôm the most active on. But as a travel blogger with a website and many other channels, Instagram limits me by only allowing one link in my bio. To make sure my followers have quick and easy access to my website, Facebook, Twitter and other social channels, I use a Bublup roll.

    Under just one URL, I‚Äôm able to save all of the places I‚Äôd like to direct my followers. My favorite thing about a roll is that it‚Äôs customizable- I‚Äôm able to choose a theme, add my own photography, and change the text. It‚Äôs the perfect solution!
    - Lauren C.

    Apartment Hunting

    Moving to a new city is stressful enough. With all the logistics of finding a new apartment I needed something to help me streamline it all. I went to Charleston, SC to check out apartments for a weekend, and looked at more than half a dozen places. Bublup was absolutely invaluable. I saved links to the community’s websites, took pictures of the apartments, made notes about dimensions, price, and thoughts I had about each one.

    When the weekend was over, I was able to sift through them all very easily. In the end I found a great place, and couldn’t be happier with my choice. Bublup took the stress out of one of the most taxing parts of my move.
    - Sean F.

    Saving Inspiration

    I use Bublup to store ideas that inspire me. For example, I have a ‘Halloween Ideas’ folder because it is one of my favorite holidays and I legit start thinking about making my costume months in advance. I‚Äôll pop in Youtube videos to cool makeup tutorials, links to items I might want on Amazon, memes, posts about celebrity gossip, or articles of ridiculous things that happened in the news that might be funny to replicate as a costume (i.e. Lady Gaga’s famous meat dress!).

    Come October, it’s easier to decide on what to make because I’ve already got a whole folder to jog my memory about all the ideas I had throughout the year.
    - Christa R.

    Discovering New Content on Trending

    I have a wide range of interests. I like to keep up with hot topics like headline news and politics but I also like to learn something new every day. Facebook used to be my go to for finding out popular news, funny new memes, tech updates, and all sorts of other things, but now it seems as though I see the same things over and over again. So I checked out Bublup Trending.

    It has completely changed my way of staying on top of things. I can change the categories so I see just the information I want most, from international politics to celebrity gossip, and tomorrow when I need some inspo for my new house, well, home and garden, Trending has me covered with some really fun (and cheap!) DIY projects.
    - Jocelyn B.

    Group Brainstorming

    An idea has to start somewhere. With Bublup it‚Äôs easy to invite a few friends to a Group Folder for an instant brainstorm, from anywhere in the world. Whether I‚Äôm soliciting wallpaper suggestions for my dining room or coming up with new ideas with my team for an upcoming campaign, everyone I invite can add files, links, videos, or images that inspire good ideas.

    I like to add my notes to the things people share based on the conversation and break ideas down into their own little subfolders with actionable next steps. For me, there is no simpler way to get all of our ideas in one place.
    - Emily T.

    Saving from Social

    As a vlogger I needed a place to store all my videos and photos. I also like to save things I see on my twitter feed, hilarious videos my friends post on instagram, and the occasional article I find on facebook since I am constantly using these materials in my vlogs.

    Once I got my Bublup folder, I had the perfect place to put it all. I can upload video files (and send them to my friends using a single link – no more messing with file transfer apps!), tons of photos straight from my phone, and save all the stuff I find on social media so everything is in one convenient place. Now when I go to film a new vlog, I can easily find what I need because it is all in Bublup.
    - Josh P.

    Working Together

    I‚Äôm always creating, saving, and sharing all types of information at work – documents, links, videos, PDFs, presentations, and spreadsheets. I thought I was organized before, saving research and important stuff by sending it to myself in an email. Or I‚Äôd save documents to the company‚Äôs server and just bookmark the links I needed later.

    But now I use Bublup because I can put everything in one place and it is so much easier to see all my content organized together for each project. As a visual person, the fact that I can put an image on everything makes processing the information in my folders much easier. And group folders allow me to quickly create places for teams to save stuff together, so I can keep tabs on progress through notifications. Want to know the best part? I don‚Äôt have to bother IT staff!
    - Jordan L.

    Researching Products

    I started hunting for a couch last year. Not one from Craigslist but like a big-kid couch. And I never realized how many choices I had!     I finally took the leap and bought a gorgeous light blue couch at a cute little furniture shop and breathed a sigh of relief. I couldn‚Äôt have done it without my Bublup folder – well that and a large cup of coffee, but who‚Äôs keeping track? üòâ
    - Amy W.
